newsitem.title: UK: Littlewoods Xmas sales up 10 pct on yr ago.
newsitem.headline: Littlewoods Xmas sales up 10 pct on yr ago.

text.p: Britain's privately-owned retail and leisure group Littlewoods Organisation said its UK retail sales in the six weeks to December 28 were up 10 percent on the same period a year ago.

It said in a statement that for the full 12 months to December 28, 1996 it recorded "an encouraging increase in UK retail sales and this will contribute to operating profits significantly ahead of 1995."
Earlier, Littlewoods announced that it had bought agency mail order business Freemans from British retailer Sears Plc for 395 million stg cash.

Referring to sales growth in the Christmas 1996 period, Littlewoods said this was underpinned by strong sales in its home shopping business which rose by 12.6 percent, boosted by a significant increase in sales per agent in its agency business and growth in its new Index Extra direct catalogue sales.
It said sales at its high street Index stores were up 11.7 percent in total compared to a year ago, and by 6.6 percent on a like-for-like basis.
Sales at its Littlewoods stores were 5.4 percent higher in total in the six week period, but 3.4 percent on a like-for-like basis.
"The performance of Littlewoods stores has been below expectations and we will be reviewing the current strategy for this division," the group said in a statement.
It added that it was changing its accounting reference date from December to April.
It said it would issue a second set of interim results in March covering the 12 months to December 1996 and results for the 16 months to April 1997 would be announced in July.
